name: Sandra Kent
statement:
**Elected Experience**  
Appointed Richland Council in 2008; re-elected in 2009, 2011, 2013, 2017. Served on Richland Planning Commission 2 years.  Current Mayor Pro Tem.  
  
**Other Professional Experience**  
More 30 years regulatory and management experience.  Currently at Hanford Mission Integration Solutions as Deputy Chief Counsel.  
  
**Education**  
Bachelor’s in Urban Affairs & Land Use Planning, University of Missouri-Kansas City; juris doctor, University of Kansas; Leadership Tri-Cities graduate.  Previous certifications in hazardous waste worker/supervisor, construction and project management.  
  
**Community Service**  
Liaison to Richland Parks Commission and Library Board; Former President, Regional Public Facilities District and Women Helping Women Fund; Former member, TRIDEC, United Way and WSBA Committee on Professionalism.  
  
**Statement**  
I am running for re-election because I have the skills, devotion and experience to help make the tough decisions facing us.  I have worked in several states across the country in various levels of government and the private sector.  I possess real world experience in the areas of facility operations, compliance, enforcement, contracts, employment and labor matters.  In today’s environment, we must be prudent in our spending but strategic in our thinking.  Cooperation and collaboration will continue to be key in successfully creating lasting partnerships and ensuring we are doing the best for each other.  Together we can continue to make Richland the best place to live and raise our families.
